001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
006
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 * Represents a loss function that operates at the batch level,
011 * i.e., across multiple samples. A batch is typically a collection
012 * of samples used together in training for efficiency and stability
013 * of gradient-based optimization.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * A {@code BatchLossFunction} leverages a {@link SampleLossFunction}
017 * together with a set of {@link DimensionLossFunction}s to compute
018 * the overall loss for an entire batch of samples.
019 */
020@DomainObject
021@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
022public interface BatchLossFunction extends LossFunction {
023
024    /**
025     * Calculates the total loss for a batch of samples.
026     *
027     * <p>
028     * Each sample in the batch is represented as a {@link Pair} of
029     * float arrays, where the left element is the estimated (predicted)
030     * values and the right element is the target (expected) values.
031     * The provided {@link SampleLossFunction} and associated list of
032     * {@link DimensionLossFunction}s are used to compute the loss for
033     * each sample, which is then aggregated into the batch loss.
034     * </p>
035     *
036     * @param batch         a list of samples, where each sample is a pair
037     *                      of {@code float[]} arrays (estimated vs target)
038     * @param lossFunctions a pair consisting of a {@link SampleLossFunction}
039     *                      (for per-sample loss calculation) and the list
040     *                      of {@link DimensionLossFunction}s used within
041     *                      that sample loss calculation
042     * @return the aggregated batch loss as a {@code float}
043     */
044    float calculateBatchLoss(List<Pair<float[], float[]>> batch, Pair<SampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction>> lossFunctions);
045
046}
